intro: Oxalis europaea, commonly known as the wood sorrel, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant produces edible leaves and flowers, though they should be consumed in moderation due to their oxalic acid content. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Oxalis europaea is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
